public class IdtFrame
extends AbstractModelessWindow
implements ComponentSelectionListener

The main window for the IDT administration module which allows the administrator to modiy IDT reticketing recrods

Author:
rterrell

Method Detail

initFrame

protected void initFrame()
Performs specific constructor related tasks for this window.

Changes the text of the cancel and Ok buttons to "Exit List" and "Modify Qty", respectively. Adds the refresh button and dht find sku button and arranges the order which the buttons are displayed.

Overrides:
initFrame in class AbstractModelessWindow

createContentLayout

public javax.swing.JPanel createContentLayout()
Uses the MigLayout to add the controls needed for this window.

Specified by:
createContentLayout in interface WindowProcessTemplateListener

refreshDataGrid

protected void refreshDataGrid()
Repopulates the data grid by querying the database for all active IDT reticketing SKUs.

Any filters that were previously applied will be ignored.

Throws:
DatabaseException - Genreal database access errors.

refreshDataGrid

protected void refreshDataGrid(SkuItem item)
                        throws DatabaseException
Repopulates the dataa grid by querying the database for a subset of reticketing SKU's using item as query selection criteria.

The properties of item used to filter the query results are optional and include department, class, vendor, style, color, and size. Only those properties containing a non-null value are applied to the query's where clause. In order to return all of the reticketing items, all qualifying properties must be set to null values.

Parameters:
item - An instance of SkuItem providing selection criteria. The properties targeted as selection criteria items are department, class, vendor, style, color, and size.
Throws:
DatabaseException - General database access errors.

filterDataBySkuNo

protected void filterDataBySkuNo()
Fetches all IDT reticketing items that are associated with a given SKU number.

Before any database fetching is performed, the SKU number is obtained from an input dialog. Once the SKU is provided, an existence check of the SKU is performed against the idt_sku table, and if valid, the data grid is refreshed with IDT reticketing data as it relates to the SKU.

filterDataBySkuDetails

protected void filterDataBySkuDetails()
Fetches IDT reticketing items that matches one or more SKU selection criteria: department, class, vendor, style, color and/or size.

Before any database fetching is performed, the SKU criteria details are gathered from an input dialog. Once the detail SKU criteria is provided, the data grid is refreshed with IDT reticketing data.

getInputData

public java.lang.Object getInputData()
                              throws InvalidDataException
Opens an input dialog for gathering the Quantity Sent value and returns the value to the caller.

This method is triggered by the user clicking the Modify Qty button.

Specified by:
getInputData in interface WindowProcessTemplateListener
Returns:
Integer as the Quantity Sent entered by the user.
Throws:
InvalidDataException - Invalid data errors recognized by the dialog.

processData

public java.lang.Object processData(java.lang.Object data)
                             throws LaunchPadException
Updates the quantity sent of a reticketing item using value entered by the users in the method, getInputData().

If the quantity sent value is greater than zero, the reticketed item's quantity should be update in the idt_retick table. If the quantity sent is equal to zero, then the reticketing item be deleted from the database.

Before a record is deleted, a dialog is displayed forcing the user to confirm his/her intent to delete. Upon delete confirmation, the delete operation entails the removal of the reticketing item from the idt_retick and idt_sku tables.

Specified by:
processData in interface WindowProcessTemplateListener
Parameters:
data - The quantity sent value entered by the user, which its runtime value should evaluate to an Integer.
Returns:
The total number of rows effected by the update/delete operation.
Throws:
LaunchPadException - General database access errors.

handleSelectionChanged

public void handleSelectionChanged(ComponentItemSelectedEvent evt)
Dynamically manages the state of the Modify Qty button.

The Modify button is enabled only when a row int he data grid is selected.

Specified by:
handleSelectionChanged in interface ComponentSelectionListener
Parameters:
evt - an instance of ComponentItemSelectedEvent

showSelectedShortSku

protected void showSelectedShortSku()
Opens a dialog that displays the short SKU number associated with the selected reticketing item. If the SKU is not found, a message stating the obvious is displayed instead.
